meta.content: Excellence—Every School, Every Student, Every Day. Hopkins Public Schools is an innovative Minnesota school district with programs in STEM, digital content and access, elementary world language, elementary and secondary immersion programs, International Baccalaureate (IB), Gifted & Talented, Advanced Placement, College in the Schools, and Response to Intervention. We serve the

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Excellence—Every School, Every Student, Every Day. Hopkins Public Schools is an innovative Minnesota school district with programs in STEM, digital content and access, elementary world language, elementary and secondary immersion programs, International Baccalaureate (IB), Gifted & Talented, and Response to Intervention. We serve the city of Hopkins, most of Minnetonka, about half of Golden Valley, and portions of Eden Prairie, Edina, Plymouth, and St. Louis Park.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: excellent, excellence, STEM, Science Technology Engineering Mathematics, Chinese immersion, Gifted & Talented, Response to Intervention, digital content & access, Excellence—Every School Every Student Every Day

a.title: Information about each of our excellent schools
Hopkins elementary schools are kindergarten through grade six. Some schools offer preschool programs as well.
Our Junior High Schools are grades 7 through 9, and our High School is grades 10 through 12.

li.class: first last leaf menu-mlid-22630 link-transition-plus-program link-node-35730

a.title: Transition Plus is a joint program between Hopkins, St. Louis Park, and Minnetonka school districts that works with young adults with disabilities, ages 18 to 21.

div.div: We are pleased to announce that the Hopkins Education Foundation (HEF) has come through in a big way for our school district and has agreed to host a crowdsourcing campaign through May 13.

div.class: node node-ss-news node-teaser node-type-ss-news-teaser node-large-image clearfix

h3.a: Help us support our frontline employees

div.div: Please help us support our frontline workers by writing to your legislator and asking them to add emergency funding to bill HF4415 DE10

div.class: node node-page node-teaser node-type-page-teaser node-large-image clearfix

h3.a: Pre-order Free Student Meals for Week of May 4-10

div.div: Student meals have expanded to 7-day service. All Hopkins families are encouraged to order free student meals.

div.class: node node-ss-link node-teaser node-type-ss-link-teaser node-large-image clearfix

div.div: Distance Learning begins for Hopkins Public Schools on April 6 and will continue until May 5. Here you will find answers to questions about Distance Learning. You can also view learning plans.

div.class: node node-ss-homepage node-detail node-type-ss-homepage-detail node-full clearfix

a.title: This is for staff access to Campus. Students and Parents need to use the Student & Parent Portal login on the homepage of the district or each school.
Our school district seeks qualified applicants who are innovative, enthusiastic, and looking for the opportunity to make a difference.
